t: Amazon Rainforest | Plants, Animals, Climate, & Deforestation | Britannica
s: July 20, 1998 - Amazon Rainforest, large tropical rainforest occupying the Amazon basin in northern South America and covering an area of 2,300,000 square miles (6,000,000 square km). It is the world’s richest and most-varied biological reservoir, containing several million species.

t: What would happen if the Amazon rainforest dried out? This decades-long experiment has some answers | AP News
s: In a pristine corner of the Amazon, Brazilian and British scientists have spent more than two decades simulating drought to understand how the rainforest might respond to a drier future.
